title: How to Put Flat Paint on Semi Gloss Paint

steps.headline: Mix a cup of TSP cleaner into a gallon of warm water.
steps.description: Wear rubber gloves if you have sensitive skin. With your sponge, wipe down your walls with the TSP, then wipe them again with a sponge dipped in clean water.

steps.headline: Rough up the gloss on your semi-gloss paint.
steps.description: There are two ways to do this. Sand the entire wall with 100-grit sandpaper. Use a pole sander. You do not need to sand to bare wall. All you need to do is to rough up the shine of the semi-gloss paint. The other way is to use a paint brush and apply a deglosser (available at most good hardware stores). You'll spread on a coat of deglosser with your brush and then wipe it off with a clean cloth. Then rub your wall down with a wet sponge frequently dipped in clean water.

steps.headline: Wipe walls with a tack cloth after sanding.
Paint on a coat of good primer, and allow to dry.
steps.description: Paint with a medium-grade (or better) flat paint.

steps.headline: Or, skip the primer and paint two coats of medium-grade (or better) flat paint if that is easier or cheap.

text: Mix a cup of TSP cleaner into a gallon of warm water. Wear rubber gloves if you have sensitive skin. With your sponge, wipe down your walls with the TSP, then wipe them again with a sponge dipped in clean water. Rough up the gloss on your semi-gloss paint. There are two ways to do this. Sand the entire wall with 100-grit sandpaper. Use a pole sander. You do not need to sand to bare wall. All you need to do is to rough up the shine of the semi-gloss paint. The other way is to use a paint brush and apply a deglosser (available at most good hardware stores). You'll spread on a coat of deglosser with your brush and then wipe it off with a clean cloth. Then rub your wall down with a wet sponge frequently dipped in clean water. Wipe walls with a tack cloth after sanding.  Paint on a coat of good primer, and allow to dry. Paint with a medium-grade (or better) flat paint. Or, skip the primer and paint two coats of medium-grade (or better) flat paint if that is easier or cheap.
